title: Very wide service port span
reason: Rules with “any” service or thousands of ports increase attack surface and complicate monitoring.
recommendation: Replace “any” with specific ports needed. Document business justification and review yearly.

title: HTTP allowed (80/tcp)
reason: Plain HTTP transmits data unencrypted and may allow interception of credentials.
recommendation: Use HTTPS for all web applications. Keep port 80 only for automatic redirects and enforce TLS 1.2+.

title: HTTP exposed to/from internet-like
reason: Internet-facing HTTP should be encrypted; attackers can modify or intercept unprotected traffic.
recommendation: Disable external HTTP or redirect to HTTPS via a secure reverse proxy/WAF.

title: SMTP exposed to/from internet-like
reason: Open SMTP can be exploited for spam relays or phishing. Unencrypted email traffic leaks credentials.
recommendation: Route all outbound mail through a secured relay. Enforce STARTTLS and restrict inbound SMTP to approved mail servers.
